CharacterSet.Name: 5 Team +Minipaddy DPS
CharacterSet.Description: Generated by ISBoxer 42 Quick Setup Wizard - 14/05/2020

VirtualFile.Name: Battle.net.config
VirtualFile.Description: Battle.net.config stores your Battle.net stored account information and other launcher settings. This Virtual File allows different Battle.net.config files per Character.

VirtualFile.Name: Config.WTF
VirtualFile.Description: Config.WTF stores your last Battle.net and World of Warcraft account names, last realm and characters played, as well as video, sound and other settings. This Virtual File allows different Config.WTF files per Character.

VirtualFile.Name: Software/Blizzard Entertainment/Battle.net/
VirtualFile.Description: HKCU/Software/Blizzard Entertainment/Battle.net/ stores your Battle.net and World of Warcraft account information, and other settings.

WindowLayout.Name: 5 Team +Minipaddy DPS
WindowLayout.Description: This Window Layout features maximum usage of a single monitor. Swapping enabled. Includes a home region for every window. Leaves space for the Windows taskbar.

KeyMap.Name: ISB42 - Always On
KeyMap.Description: This Key Map is to contain only Hotkeys that should never be toggled OFF. By default, this includes overall control mechanisms, such as toggling Broadcasting Mode, or toggling other Hotkeys.

MappedKey.Name: Activate Repeat
MappedKey.Description: This toggles both Key and Mouse Repeat (1 to 1 broadcasting for both keyboard and mouse) from the current window to all others.

MappedKey.Name: Activate Mouse Repeat
MappedKey.Description: This toggles Mouse Repeat (1 to 1 broadcasting for the mouse) from the current window to all others. It does not have a Hotkey by default.

MappedKey.Name: Toggle Formations Menu
MappedKey.Description: This key can be used to toggle the Formations Menu

MappedKey.Name: Next window
MappedKey.Description: This key can be used to rotate to the next window.

MappedKey.Name: Previous window
MappedKey.Description: This key can be used to rotate to the previous window.

MappedKey.Name: Toggle Chat Mode
MappedKey.Description: This Hotkey will temporarily enable a White List for Broadcasting Mode, in order to only broadcast certain buttons (e.g. to attack if needed) but not others (e.g. so you can type in chat in one window)

KeyMap.Name: ISB42 - Base Hotkeys
KeyMap.Description: This Key Map contains general use Hotkeys, which can be toggled by default by Activate Maps (Shift+Alt+M). Most of the default Mapped Keys use Do Mapped Key Action to perform behaviors from another Key Map.

MappedKey.Name: All Jump
MappedKey.Description: Makes your other characters jump. Configure a Hotkey, such as Ctrl+Space, to try this out!

MappedKey.Name: Flying V Formation
MappedKey.Description:
Make sure your movement keys are configured under Variable Keystrokes in order to use this Formation!
The Flying V aligns your characters in a V behind the active character

MappedKey.Name: Line Formation
MappedKey.Description:
Make sure your movement keys are configured under Variable Keystrokes in order to use this Formation!
The Line formation aligns your characters in a line to the left and right of the active character.

MappedKey.Name: Star Formation
MappedKey.Description:
Make sure your movement keys are configured under Variable Keystrokes in order to use this Formation!
The Star formation aligns your characters in all four directions around the leader (forward, backward, left and right). Works for up to 5 characters.

MappedKey.Name: Others turn Left
MappedKey.Description:
Make sure your movement keys are configured under Variable Keystrokes in order to use this!
This can be used to break auto-follow (some games do not provide a more convenient method), just set a Hotkey and, if needed, change the key it sends to the other windows in step 1.

MappedKey.Name: Others turn Right
MappedKey.Description:
Make sure your movement keys are configured under Variable Keystrokes in order to use this!
This can be used to break auto-follow (some games do not provide a more convenient method), just set a Hotkey and, if needed, change the key it sends to the other windows in step 1.

MappedKey.Name: Interact with Target
MappedKey.Description: Interact with Target will help you interact with NPCs (e.g. merchants, quest givers and enemies) and, when combined with Click to Move, can be used to keep melees on target. See http://isboxer.com/wiki/WoW:Interact_with_Target.

MappedKey.Name: Face Toward Target
MappedKey.Description: Interact with Target will help you interact with NPCs (e.g. merchants, quest givers and enemies) and, when combined with Click to Move, can be used to keep melees on target. See http://isboxer.com/wiki/WoW:Interact_with_Target.

MappedKey.Name: Invite Team
MappedKey.Description: For World of Warcraft, this is configured by default to invite your configured Character Set. For other games, configure an Invite Team method in ISB42 - Party, and set it as the Active Method for your Character Set.

MappedKey.Name: Toggle Jamba Follow Strobing (WoW)
MappedKey.Description: Jamba Addon provides a Follow Strobing feature, which attempts to keep re-following your Master (outside of combat) to help prevent or mitigate lost characters.

Step.Name: Do Activate Repeat twice to reset to current state
Do Activate Repeat twice to reset to current state
Do Activate Repeat twice to reset to current state
Do Activate Repeat twice to reset to current state
Do Activate Repeat twice to reset to current state
Do Activate Repeat twice to reset to current state

KeyMap.Name: ISB42 - Toggles
KeyMap.Description: This Key Map is not toggled OFF by the Hotkeys toggle and is not intended to contain any Hotkeys! Use a Do Mapped Key Action to Window:Current to perform any of these Mapped Keys. (As in ISB42 - Always On)

MappedKey.Name: Activate Repeat (current window)
MappedKey.Description: This toggles both Key and Mouse Repeat (1 to 1 broadcasting for both keyboard and mouse) from the current window to all others.

MappedKey.Name: Activate Repeat (all windows)
MappedKey.Description: This toggles both Key and Mouse Repeat (1 to 1 broadcasting for both keyboard and mouse) from all windows, to all others.

MappedKey.Name: Activate Mouse Repeat (current window)
MappedKey.Description: This toggles Mouse Repeat (1 to 1 broadcasting for the mouse) from the current window to all others. It does not have a Hotkey by default.

KeyMap.Name: ISB42 - Party
KeyMap.Description:
This Key Map is not toggled OFF by the Hotkeys toggle and is not intended to contain any Hotkeys! Use a Do Mapped Key Action to Window:Current to perform any of these Mapped Keys. (As in ISB42 - Base Hotkeys)
Contains different methods of Follow and Assist. Some games will only work with certain methods.
The Active Methods are set up in your Character Set under Virtual Mapped Keys!

MappedKeyAction.Text: Follow Me: No Follow Method Active!

MappedKey.Name: Follow Me (Follow FTL + Slot ID Modifier)

MappedKeyAction.Text: Assist Me: No Assist Method Active!

MappedKey.Name: Assist Me (Assist FTL + Slot ID Modifier)

MappedKeyAction.Text: Interact with Target: No Interact Method Active!

MappedKey.Name: Interact with Target - Standard
MappedKey.Description: Interact with Target will help you interact with NPCs (e.g. merchants, quest givers and enemies) and, when combined with Click to Move, can be used to keep melees on target. See http://isboxer.com/wiki/WoW:Interact_with_Target.

MappedKey.Name: Interact with Target - Face Target
MappedKey.Description: Interact with Target will help you interact with NPCs (e.g. merchants, quest givers and enemies) and, when combined with Click to Move, can be used to keep melees on target. See http://isboxer.com/wiki/WoW:Interact_with_Target.

MappedKey.Name: Auto-Interact with Target - Standard
MappedKey.Description: This is the same as Interact with Target - Standard with the exception of no auto-assist, and Click to Move is left enabled in WoW

KeyMap.Name: ISB42 - Combat Broadcast
KeyMap.Description: This Key Map is not toggled OFF by the Hotkeys toggle and is not intended to contain any Hotkeys! Use a Do Mapped Key Action to Window:Current to perform the actual broadcast of 1 through = and modified versions. (As in ISB42 - Combat Broadcast Hotkeys)

KeyMap.Name: ISB42 - Combat Broadcast Hotkeys
KeyMap.Description: This Key Map contains Combat Broadcasting Hotkeys, which can be toggled by default by Activate Maps (Shift+Alt+M). Most of the default Mapped Keys use Do Mapped Key Action to perform behaviors from ISB42 - Combat Broadcast. You can easily configure different behaviors for different teams by copying ISB42 - Combat Broadcast, and then use Key Map Virtualization to set ISB42 - Combat Broadcast "is now" your new Key Map.

KeyMap.Name: ISB42 - WoW
KeyMap.Description: This Key Map is not toggled OFF by the Hotkeys toggle and is not intended to contain any Hotkeys! Use a Do Mapped Key Action to Window:Current to perform any of these Mapped Keys. (As in ISB42 - Base Hotkeys and ISB42 - Party)

MappedKey.Name: Click to Move Off
MappedKey.Description: This turns Click to Move off. It is used by the Interact with Target key in the Non-combat Key Map.

MappedKey.Name: Click to Move On
MappedKey.Description: This turns Click to Move on. It is used by the Interact with Target key in the Non-combat Key Map.

MappedKey.Name: JambaMaster
MappedKey.Description:
This tells the Jamba Addon to tell the other characters the current one is master.
The Quick Setup Wizard uses this and similar mappings for whatever character switching (e.g. follow upon character switch) options were selected on the last page. A different Mapped Key can be selected later if desired, by selecting it per Slot in your Character Set (in a drop-down box on the right side). Or just run the wizard again...

MappedKey.Name: JambaStrobe Off
MappedKey.Description: This tells the Jamba Addon to turn off follow strobing. It is used by Toggle Jamba Follow Strobing in the Non-combat Key Map.

MappedKey.Name: JambaStrobe On
MappedKey.Description: This tells the Jamba Addon to turn on follow strobing. It is used by Toggle Jamba Follow Strobing.

MappedKey.Name: Follow/JambaMaster
MappedKey.Description:
This uses the Follow Me key under the Non-combat Key Map, and the JambaMaster key under this Key Map. It does not have a Hotkey by default.
The Quick Setup Wizard uses this and similar mappings for whatever character switching (e.g. follow upon character switch) options were selected on the last page. A different Mapped Key can be selected later if desired, by selecting it per Slot in your Character Set (in a drop-down box on the right side). Or just run the wizard again...

MappedKey.Name: Follow/JambaStrobe
MappedKey.Description:
This uses the Follow Me key under the Non-combat Key Map, and the JambaStrobe On key under this Key Map. It does not have a Hotkey by default.
The Quick Setup Wizard uses this and similar mappings for whatever character switching (e.g. follow upon character switch) options were selected on the last page. A different Mapped Key can be selected later if desired, by selecting it per Slot in your Character Set (in a drop-down box on the right side). Or just run the wizard again...

MappedKey.Name: Follow/JambaStrobe/JambaMaster
MappedKey.Description:
This uses the Follow Me key under the Non-combat Key Map, the JambaMaster and the JambaStrobe On key under this Key Map. It does not have a Hotkey by default.
The Quick Setup Wizard uses this and similar mappings for whatever character switching (e.g. follow upon character switch) options were selected on the last page. A different Mapped Key can be selected later if desired, by selecting it per Slot in your Character Set (in a drop-down box on the right side). Or just run the wizard again...

MappedKey.Name: Toggle Jamba Follow Strobing
MappedKey.Description: Turns Jamba Follow Strobing on or off

MappedKey.Name: Target Me
MappedKey.Description: This is an FTL-based Target Me. It relies on an in-game /target macro per Character in order to target the right toon.

KeyMap.Name: ISB42 - Custom Hotkeys
KeyMap.Description: This Key Map can contain your own custom Hotkeys, which can be toggled by default by Activate Maps (Shift+Alt+M).

MappedKey.Name: Use this Key Map for custom Hotkeys!

WoWMacroSet.Name: Quick Setup 42
WoWMacroSet.Description: This WoW Macro Set contains all of the macros generated by the Quick Setup Wizard from ISBoxer 42

WoWMacro.Name: FTLAssist
WoWMacro.Description: Assists a specific character, depending on the optional modifiers included.

WoWMacro.Name: FTLFocus
WoWMacro.Description: Sets the Focus Target to a specific character, depending on the optional modifiers included.
Sets the Focus Target to a specific character's Target, depending on the optional modifiers included.

WoWMacro.Name: FTLFollow
WoWMacro.Description: Auto-follows a specific character, depending on the optional modifiers included.

WoWMacro.Name: FTLTarget
WoWMacro.Description: Targets a specific character, depending on the optional modifiers included.

WoWMacro.Name: InviteTeam
WoWMacro.Description: Invites up to 5 Slots in the current Character Set to party

WoWMacro.Name: CTMOn
WoWMacro.Description: Enables Click-to-Move. This is commonly used with Interact with Target to cause a Character to move toward its target.

WoWMacro.Name: JambaMaster
WoWMacro.Description: This will have the Jamba WoW Addon send a message via in-game Addon communications to the other Characters, instructing them to set this Character as its Master.

WoWMacro.Name: JambaStrobeOn
WoWMacro.Description: This will have the Jamba WoW Addon send a message via in-game Addon communications to the other Characters, instructing them to enable its Auto-follow Strobing feature on this Character.

WoWMacro.Name: JambaStrobeOff
WoWMacro.Description: This will have the Jamba WoW Addon send a message via in-game Addon communications to the other Characters, instructing them to disable Auto-follow Strobing.

Reloads the WoW interface. This will activate any ISBoxer WoW Macro changes made (after an Export while playing). If you want to use this, you will need either a Key Combination, or a /click button name!

VariableKeystroke.Name: Move Forward
VariableKeystroke.Description: Moves the character forward. (Requires HOLD option on Mapped Key)

VariableKeystroke.Name: Move Backward
VariableKeystroke.Description: Moves the character backward. (Requires HOLD option on Mapped Key)

VariableKeystroke.Name: Turn Left
VariableKeystroke.Description: Turns the character counter-clockwise. (Requires HOLD option on Mapped Key)

VariableKeystroke.Name: Turn Right
VariableKeystroke.Description: Turns the character clockwise. (Requires HOLD option on Mapped Key)

VariableKeystroke.Name: Move Left
VariableKeystroke.Description: Strafes the character left. (Requires HOLD option on Mapped Key)

VariableKeystroke.Name: Move Right
VariableKeystroke.Description: Strafes the character right. (Requires HOLD option on Mapped Key)

VariableKeystroke.Name: Jump
VariableKeystroke.Description: Makes the character jump. (May require HOLD option on Mapped Key)

VariableKeystroke.Name: Follow Target
VariableKeystroke.Description: Most MMORPGs include an Auto-Follow feature, which is useful to move your characters together as a group.

VariableKeystroke.Name: Assist Target
VariableKeystroke.Description: Causes the character to select his target's target, such as to assist in combat against the same enemy. Most games include this feature.

VariableKeystroke.Name: Target Self
VariableKeystroke.Description: Causes the character to select himself.

VariableKeystroke.Name: Target Slot 1
VariableKeystroke.Description: This can be configured individually for each Slot in your Character Set, in order to target the Character in Slot 1, in the game. This is useful for being able to easily Auto-Follow or Assist each window, for games that cannot easily do those things on a per-Character basis.

VariableKeystroke.Name: Target Slot 2
VariableKeystroke.Description: This can be configured individually for each Slot in your Character Set, in order to target the Character in Slot 2, in the game. This is useful for being able to easily Auto-Follow or Assist each window, for games that cannot easily do those things on a per-Character basis.

VariableKeystroke.Name: Target Slot 3
VariableKeystroke.Description: This can be configured individually for each Slot in your Character Set, in order to target the Character in Slot 3, in the game. This is useful for being able to easily Auto-Follow or Assist each window, for games that cannot easily do those things on a per-Character basis.

VariableKeystroke.Name: Target Slot 4
VariableKeystroke.Description: This can be configured individually for each Slot in your Character Set, in order to target the Character in Slot 4, in the game. This is useful for being able to easily Auto-Follow or Assist each window, for games that cannot easily do those things on a per-Character basis.

VariableKeystroke.Name: Target Slot 5
VariableKeystroke.Description: This can be configured individually for each Slot in your Character Set, in order to target the Character in Slot 5, in the game. This is useful for being able to easily Auto-Follow or Assist each window, for games that cannot easily do those things on a per-Character basis.

VariableKeystroke.Name: Target Slot 6
VariableKeystroke.Description: This can be configured individually for each Slot in your Character Set, in order to target the Character in Slot 6, in the game. This is useful for being able to easily Auto-Follow or Assist each window, for games that cannot easily do those things on a per-Character basis.

VariableKeystroke.Name: Interact with Target
VariableKeystroke.Description: While most MMORPGs require actually clicking with the mouse to perform the default 'right click' action, others including World of Warcraft provide a configurable Hotkey for the same capability.

VariableKeystroke.Name: Focus my Target
VariableKeystroke.Description: Focus is a secondary target available in some games, to remain 'focused' on a target while still being able to click or otherwise select others.

VariableKeystroke.Name: Follow FTL
VariableKeystroke.Description: If custom in-game /follow macros are available (RIFT and WoW), this keystroke can be combined with 'FTL Modifiers' to /follow a specific Character.

VariableKeystroke.Name: Assist FTL
VariableKeystroke.Description: If custom in-game /assist macros are available (RIFT and WoW), this keystroke can be combined with 'FTL Modifiers' to /assist a specific Character.

VariableKeystroke.Name: Target FTL
VariableKeystroke.Description: If custom in-game /target macros are available (RIFT and WoW), this keystroke can be combined with 'FTL Modifiers' to /target a specific Character.

VariableKeystroke.Name: Assist Main
VariableKeystroke.Description: This can be configured to enable simply Assisting a pre-determined Main Character

VariableKeystroke.Name: Follow Main
VariableKeystroke.Description: This can be configured to enable simply Following a pre-determined Main Character

VariableKeystroke.Name: Target Party Leader
VariableKeystroke.Description: If the game provides a key binding for targeting the Party Leader directly, this can be used to enable easily Following/Assisting the Party Leader

VariableKeystroke.Name: Invite Team
VariableKeystroke.Description: This can be configured to complete set up of the 'Invite Team' Mapped Key.

MenuButtonSet.Name: ISB42 - Toggles
MenuButtonSet.Description: Quick Setup Wizard 42 - Standard Toggles Menu Buttons, i.e. Hotkeys and Broadcasting

MenuButtonSet.Name: ISB42 - Formations
MenuButtonSet.Description: Quick Setup Wizard 42 - Standard Formations Menu Buttons for activating Flying V, 4-point Star, or Line formations

MenuHotkeySet.Name: Standard
MenuHotkeySet.Description: Quick Setup Wizard 42 - Standard 12-button Menu Hotkeys

MenuHotkeySet.Name: Standard SHIFT
MenuHotkeySet.Description: Quick Setup Wizard 42 - Standard 12-button Menu Hotkeys with SHIFT

MenuHotkeySet.Name: Standard ALT
MenuHotkeySet.Description: Quick Setup Wizard 42 - Standard 12-button Menu Hotkeys with ALT

MenuHotkeySet.Name: Standard CTRL
MenuHotkeySet.Description: Quick Setup Wizard 42 - Standard 12-button Menu Hotkeys with CTRL

MenuTemplate.Name: Formations
MenuTemplate.Description: Quick Setup Wizard 42 - Standard Formations Menu Template

MenuTemplate.Name: Toggles
MenuTemplate.Description: Quick Setup Wizard 42 - Standard Toggles Menu Template

MenuTemplate.Name: Standard
MenuTemplate.Description: Quick Setup Wizard 42 - Standard 12-button Menu Template
